summary:
You guys remember when a girl
posted this on her instagram: And got bullied so bad by J0nerys folks,
just for saying that Sophie...
body:
You guys remember when a girl posted this on her instagram:

And got bullied so bad by J0nerys folks, just for saying that Sophie was also in Croatia, that she had to delete the post?

Well…

It was true!!! Sophie was in Croatia with Kit and Lena. Any predictions?

Credits to @Starkyred and @Goodkingjon in twitter

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Rule of three predictions (show only)
body:
Rule of three predictions (show only)

* Tyrion’s third trial (Bran’s attack, Joffrey’s murder, TBD)

* Jon’s third throne/crown (Lord Commander, KITN, KOT7K)

* Dany’s third fire (Drogo’s pyre, khals, TBD)


* Sandor’s third “tournament fight/win” in the presence of Sansa Stark (Tourney of the Hand, Joffrey’s Name-Day Tournament, mortal combat with the Night King)

* Sansa’s third wedding (Tyrion, Ramsay, Sandor Clegane)

summary: Do you know why Ned is only explained to Arya of how dangerous KL is? Not, to Sansa as well. Especially, Sansa is the one who...
question: Do you know why Ned is only explained to Arya of how dangerous KL is? Not, to Sansa as well. Especially, Sansa is the one who have to spend the rest of her life in KL. Other than that, she is the future Queen as well. Do you think that Sansa needs to look like Lyanna to make Ned loves her? Or, atleast care and not being so neglectful towards Sansa?
answer:
First, hello anon!

Now as for the question, Ned favored Arya over Sansa. I believe it was because she was a tomboy. She liked fighting and swords and Ned might have seen her as easier to talk to than Sansa.

Ned didn’t really know Sansa. Yes, he loved both his daughters and was willing to sacrifice his honor for their safety. However, Ned sorely lacked on his relationship with Sansa. He never took the time to really get to know her. Always leaving her in the hands of her Septa. This shows after he is forced to execute Lady for the crimes of Joffery and Arya.

We never see him go to her and explain the situation to her. We never see him even apologize for it. He has a doll made up for her and gives it to her as if that will heal the traumatic experience of losing a beloved pet. This is seen as a “bratty” moment of Sansa when she tells Ned she hasn’t played with dolls since she was 8 years old. But really this is an example that Ned has no clue of her current interests and never bothered to learn them either.

But with Arya, her interest are something he’s able to understand. And he is able to bring in a teacher that fits her passion. This is one of the reasons I believe he went to Arya and told her about the situation in King’s Landing. He knew how to talk to her and perhaps thought she’d have a better understanding of it. Unfortunately, he never gave that chance for Sansa to realize they were in danger as well.

Another major parenting mistake from Ned is using Sansa as a pawn to investigate the Lannisters under the cover of Sansa’s betrothal to Joffery. After the incident at the Trident, Arya, a child even asks Ned “why would you let her marry someone like that?” And Ned, a grown ass man has no answer for her.

As for the resemblance to Lyanna, that could very well be a component in Ned’s favoring of Arya. Ned does say how Arya even sometimes looks like the little sister he tragically lost. But I don’t believe Sansa had to look like Lyanna in order for Ned to love her as Ned did love Sansa. I can never be 100% sure on what Sansa could have done for Ned to give her more attention. But I think it’s another example of Sansa’s femininity being used against her. Perhaps, if she had been more boyish like Arya, Ned would have felt he could have talked to her the way he did with Arya.

I hope that makes sense.

Thanks for the ask!

tags: เกมล่าบัลลังก์
summary: Sophie Turner and Maisie Williams Like to Get High in Bathtubs
title: Sophie Turner and Maisie Williams Like to Get High in Bathtubs
excerpt: “We’d rub makeup brushes on our faces.”
description:
Maisie and Sophie talking about smoking weed while watching vids might be the most amusing part of this article. But what I found most fascinating was the high degree of security observed during the production of Season 8:

“The secrecy is crazy,” said Turner. “We have a whole different name for it when we’re shooting it. I think this season it was like the Tree of Life or something.” The actors’ names are changed on the script and the call sheets. Turner said they also have a “drone killer” that shoots down any that fly over the set. “I don’t know how it does it. It creates like this field around and the drones just drop,” she said. “Also, we shoot fake scenes. We got into costume in Croatia because we know the paparazzi lurk around there, so we would spend like half a day doing nothing.”

Shooting down drones?! :o  Seriously – the GoT showrunners should be in charge of security for the US Congressional elections next month; hackers and other miscreants would not have a chance.

blog.name: asimplylucia
blog.title: Work Always Without Applause
blog.description: History nerd, fanfic writer, film noir lover.

summary: Taking the plunge? Writing some more before I start posting? I’m in this weird position about my next fic *sigh*. Already have 7...
body:
Six Sentence Sunday

Taking the plunge? Writing some more before I start posting? I’m in this weird position about my next fic *sigh*. Already have 7 chapters out of 11 or 12 and I don’t know what’s best… but I’ll figure it out eventually. In the meanwhile, I hope you’ll enjoy these lines!

If you ever had dinner at The Lion Gate you know what it looks like: a white-tablecloth dining room with pretentious silverware, a lounge pianist hired precisely because he doesn’t give a shit about the customers’ indifference and a stuck-up, disdainful head waiter - the key element in a fancy restaurant.

Joffrey had chosen The Lion Gate to have dinner with Cersei and Sansa that night. I couldn’t quite identify the source of that barometric shift in the Lannister household but the fact was Joffrey had decided to play ball and to pretend he was having a blast with his mother and his girlfriend; he had told us to take the two women to the restaurant and he was due to arrive later. From the nearby table where I was seated with Boros Blount, neither the blonde nor the redhead looked thrilled. Cersei had already drained her first martini while waiting for the little prick and Sansa did her best to look like the perfect fiancée, sitting demurely with her ankles crossed and smiling back at the people the Lannisters had introduced her to. All her smiles were fake but they didn’t mind, knowing she didn’t mean much to Joffrey anymore.

I couldn’t quite identify the source of that barometric shift in the Lannister household but the fact was Joffrey had decided to play ball and to pretend he was having a blast with his mother and his girlfriend; he had told us to take the two women to the restaurant and he was due to arrive later. From the nearby table where I was seated with Boros Blount, neither the blonde nor the redhead looked thrilled. Cersei had already drained her first martini while waiting for the little prick and Sansa did her best to look like the perfect fiancée, sitting demurely with her ankles crossed and smiling back at the people the Lannisters had introduced her to. All her smiles were fake but they didn’t mind, knowing she didn’t mean much to Joffrey anymore.
trail.content:
Six Sentence Sunday

Taking the plunge? Writing some more before I start posting? I’m in this weird position about my next fic *sigh*. Already have 7 chapters out of 11 or 12 and I don’t know what’s best… but I’ll figure it out eventually. In the meanwhile, I hope you’ll enjoy these lines!

If you ever had dinner at The Lion Gate you know what it looks like: a white-tablecloth dining room with pretentious silverware, a lounge pianist hired precisely because he doesn’t give a shit about the customers’ indifference and a stuck-up, disdainful head waiter - the key element in a fancy restaurant.

Joffrey had chosen The Lion Gate to have dinner with Cersei and Sansa that night. I couldn’t quite identify the source of that barometric shift in the Lannister household but the fact was Joffrey had decided to play ball and to pretend he was having a blast with his mother and his girlfriend; he had told us to take the two women to the restaurant and he was due to arrive later. From the nearby table where I was seated with Boros Blount, neither the blonde nor the redhead looked thrilled. Cersei had already drained her first martini while waiting for the little prick and Sansa did her best to look like the perfect fiancée, sitting demurely with her ankles crossed and smiling back at the people the Lannisters had introduced her to. All her smiles were fake but they didn’t mind, knowing she didn’t mean much to Joffrey anymore.

summary: New York Comic Con 2018 Sophie Turner : “I know I say this every season, but Sansa really comes into her own this season. The...
body:
New York Comic Con 2018
Sophie Turner : “I know I say this every season, but Sansa really comes into her own this season. The past few seasons for her and the whole series for her, she’s kind of been somewhat lost as a matter of where she wants to be, who she wants to be, who she wants to surround herself with, and this season she is very very self-assured. She knows what she wants. She knows what she stands for. She knows who she wants to be around, and she faces threats to that this season. But, well, we’ll see how that goes.”

reblog.comment:
